1.text: I am the rose of Sharon, and the lily of the valleys.

2.text: As the lily among thorns, so is my love among the daughters.

3.text: As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.

4.text: He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me was love.

5.text: Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I am sick of love.

6.text: His left hand is under my head, and his right hand does embrace me.

7.text: I charge you, O you daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that you stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.

8.text: The voice of my beloved! behold, he comes leaping on the mountains, skipping on the hills.

9.text: My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: behold, he stands behind our wall, he looks forth at the windows, showing himself through the lattice.

10.text: My beloved spoke, and said to me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.

11.text: For, see, the winter is past, the rain is over and gone;

12.text: The flowers appear on the earth; the time of the singing of birds is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;

13.text: The fig tree puts forth her green figs, and the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.

14.text: O my dove, that are in the clefts of the rock, in the secret places of the stairs, let me see your countenance, let me hear your voice; for sweet is your voice, and your countenance is comely.

15.text: Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines have tender grapes.

16.text: My beloved is mine, and I am his: he feeds among the lilies.

17.text: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be you like a roe or a young hart on the mountains of Bether.
